node.statement: Verify the theorem in extreme and test cases. (a) Complete transfer system: F_O = Sub(G), recover HHR Theorem 4.42. (b) Trivial transfer system: F_O = {G} union all subgroups of G (since family generated by {G} is all of Sub(G) -- WAIT: if only tr_G^G is in O then Sub_O^tr = {G}, and F_O = family generated by {G} = {subgroups of G} = Sub(G). Re-examine: the trivial transfer system should give the coarsest filtration. This suggests the correct definition may need refinement -- possibly F_O should be defined differently, using only those H where norm N_H^G is in O, not just transfer. Resolve this definitional tension. (c) G = C_p: verify explicitly for both transfer systems.
